source.name: Austin Resource Recovery
source.notes: Based on Austin Resource Recovery official guidelines.

materials.name: Plastic bottles
instructions: Empty and rinse
Replace cap
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Austin accepts #1-#5 and #7 plastics
commonMistakes: Don't include bottles with liquid

materials.name: Plastic containers
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: #1-#5 and #7 rigid plastics accepted in Austin
commonMistakes: Black plastic is often not recyclable
No styrofoam containers

materials.name: Aluminum cans
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Aluminum is infinitely recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with food residue

materials.name: Steel / tin cans
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Labels can stay on
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with food still in them

materials.name: Glass bottles and jars
instructions: Do NOT place in blue recycling cart. Austin does not accept glass curbside
Take to a glass drop-off location (green igloos found at 40+ locations citywide)
Or take to Austin Resource Recovery drop-off center
notes: Austin removed glass from curbside recycling; it must go to drop-off bins
Green igloo-shaped bins are at grocery stores and community locations across Austin
commonMistakes: Do NOT put glass in your blue recycling cart; it breaks and contaminates other recyclables
Don't put broken glass in recycling; wrap and trash it

materials.name: Cardboard
instructions: Flatten all boxes
Remove packing materials
Place in or beside blue recycling cart
notes: Break down boxes so they fit in the cart
commonMistakes: Don't include cardboard soaked with grease
Remove styrofoam inserts

materials.name: Paper and newspapers
instructions: Place in blue recycling cart
No need to remove staples
notes: Most clean dry paper is recyclable in Austin
commonMistakes: Don't include paper towels or tissues
Don't bag paper in plastic bags

materials.name: Book
instructions: Donate if in good condition. Austin Public Library, Goodwill, Half Price Books
If damaged, recycle paper pages in blue cart
Remove hardcover bindings with glossy laminate (trash them)
notes: Half Price Books in Austin buys used books
Donating is always better than recycling
commonMistakes: Don't throw usable books in trash

materials.name: Milk / juice cartons
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Cartons are accepted in Austin curbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't flatten cartons

materials.name: Aerosol cans
instructions: Must be completely empty
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Non-empty aerosols are hazardous waste
commonMistakes: Don't recycle if still pressurized

materials.name: Plastic bags
instructions: Do NOT put in blue recycling cart
Take to H-E-B, Walmart, or Target for store drop-off recycling
Otherwise place in trash
notes: Plastic bags jam Austin's recycling machinery
H-E-B stores throughout Austin accept plastic bags
commonMistakes: Never bag recyclables in plastic bags
Don't put any film plastic in the blue cart

materials.name: Styrofoam
instructions: Place in trash
Styrofoam is banned from Austin city facilities
Not accepted in any Austin recycling program
notes: Austin has been phasing out styrofoam
Some businesses in Austin no longer provide styrofoam containers
commonMistakes: Don't put styrofoam in recycling

materials.name: Food waste (all types)
instructions: Place ALL food waste in green composting cart. Austin accepts everything including meat, dairy, and bones
No need to separate; all food types accepted
Include food-soiled paper (napkins, paper towels, paper plates)
notes: Austin's composting program is one of the most comprehensive in the US
The green cart accepts ALL food; meat, bones, dairy, fish, everything
Austin composts at the industrial Hornsby Bend facility which handles meat/dairy safely
commonMistakes: Don't put food in the trash; use the green composting cart
Don't worry about separating meat from vegetables; it all goes together

materials.name: Yard waste
instructions: Place in green composting cart
Large branches: cut to 4 feet or shorter and bundle
Austin collects yard waste year-round
notes: Austin's green cart accepts both food waste and yard waste together
commonMistakes: Don't bag yard waste in plastic bags
Don't put in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Food-soiled paper
instructions: Place in green composting cart
Pizza boxes, paper plates, napkins, paper towels; all go in the green cart when food-soiled
Clean pizza box tops can also go in blue recycling cart
notes: Austin's composting program accepts food-soiled paper that can't be recycled
commonMistakes: Don't put food-soiled paper in the blue recycling cart
Food-soiled paper is NOT trash in Austin; compost it

materials.name: Batteries
instructions: Do not put in trash or recycling
Take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
Tape terminals of lithium and 9V batteries before transport
notes: Batteries can cause fires in garbage trucks
commonMistakes: Don't throw batteries in trash
Don't put in blue cart

materials.name: Electronics / E-waste
instructions: Take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center for free recycling
Best Buy and Goodwill Computer Works also accept e-waste in Austin
Delete personal data before disposal
notes: Texas law prohibits putting e-waste in the trash
commonMistakes: Don't put electronics in trash or recycling

materials.name: Paint
instructions: Take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
Latex paint: can also dry it out with kitty litter and trash
Oil-based paint: must go to hazardous waste
notes: Austin accepts paint at the Resource Recovery center for free
commonMistakes: Don't pour paint down the drain

materials.name: Motor oil
instructions: Take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
AutoZone and O'Reilly in Austin also accept used oil
notes: Most auto parts stores accept oil for free
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains

materials.name: Medications
instructions: Take to Austin police department drug take-back boxes
CVS and Walgreens in Austin participate in take-back programs
If no drop-off: mix with coffee grounds, seal, and trash
notes: Austin PD has permanent drug take-back boxes
commonMistakes: Don't flush medications

materials.name: Clothing and textiles
instructions: Donate to Goodwill, Salvation Army, or Austin's many thrift stores
Textile recycling bins throughout Austin
Worn-out textiles still accepted in textile bins
notes: Austin has a thriving thrift store scene
commonMistakes: Don't put clothing in curbside recycling

materials.name: Light bulbs
instructions: CFL and fluorescent: take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
LED bulbs: e-waste recycling
Incandescent: wrap and trash
notes: Home Depot and Lowe's in Austin accept CFL bulbs
commonMistakes: Don't put CFL bulbs in trash

materials.name: Candy wrapper
instructions: Place in trash
Metallized plastic film; not recyclable
notes: Candy wrappers look metallic but are not aluminum
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling or compost

materials.name: Chip bag
instructions: Place in trash
Metallized plastic; not recyclable in Austin
notes: The shiny interior is aluminum bonded to plastic
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Fast food wrapper
instructions: Food-soiled fast food wrappers: green composting cart
Clean wrappers: blue recycling cart if plain paper
notes: Austin's green cart accepts food-soiled paper
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy wrappers in the blue recycling cart

materials.name: Disposable coffee cups
instructions: Most lined paper cups: trash
Plastic lids: blue recycling cart
Paper sleeve: blue recycling cart
notes: The plastic lining prevents paper cup recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put lined cups in recycling

materials.name: Diapers
instructions: Place in trash
notes: Not recyclable or compostable
commonMistakes: Don't put in green composting cart

materials.name: Receipt
instructions: Place in trash; thermal paper contains BPA
Do not recycle or compost
notes: Thermal receipts contaminate recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Cooking oil / grease
instructions: Collect in a sealed container
Take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
Some restaurants accept used cooking oil
notes: Never pour oil down the drain
commonMistakes: Don't pour down sink or storm drains

materials.name: Propane tanks
instructions: Take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
Never put in trash or recycling
notes: Pressurized containers are fire and explosion risks
commonMistakes: Never puncture

materials.name: Needles / sharps
instructions: Place in FDA-cleared sharps container
Take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
notes: Never place loose sharps in trash
commonMistakes: Never put in recycling or loose in trash

materials.name: Mattress
instructions: Schedule a bulk pickup with Austin Resource Recovery
Or take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
notes: Austin offers bulk item pickup by appointment
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling

materials.name: Large / bulk items
instructions: Schedule bulk pickup through Austin 311 or online
Place at curb on scheduled day
Or take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
notes: Austin offers 2 free bulk pickups per year
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling

materials.name: Chargers and cables
instructions: Take to Best Buy or Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off
Do NOT put in blue recycling cart
notes: Cables tangle in recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Never put cables in curbside recycling

materials.name: Smartphone / phone
instructions: Factory reset first
Trade in at carrier stores or Apple/Samsung
Take to Best Buy for free recycling
notes: Illegal to put phones in trash in Texas
commonMistakes: Don't forget to wipe personal data

materials.name: Fruit / fruit scraps
instructions: Place in green composting cart
All fruit and fruit scraps accepted
notes: Austin's green cart accepts all food waste
commonMistakes: Don't put fruit in trash; compost it

materials.name: Vegetables / vegetable scraps
instructions: Place in green composting cart
notes: All vegetables accepted in Austin composting
commonMistakes: Don't put in trash

materials.name: Meat and bones
instructions: Place in green composting cart. Austin accepts ALL meat and bones
This includes raw and cooked meat, fish, poultry, and bones
notes: Unlike most cities, Austin's industrial composting facility handles meat safely
This is a key difference; most cities don't accept meat in composting
commonMistakes: Don't put in trash. Austin wants meat in the green cart
Don't worry about raw vs cooked; both accepted

materials.name: Dairy products
instructions: Place dairy products in green composting cart. Austin accepts all dairy
Pour expired milk down drain, compost the residue
notes: Austin's composting program accepts dairy unlike most cities
commonMistakes: Don't put in trash; compost it
Rinse and recycle the container separately

materials.name: Bread and grains
instructions: Place in green composting cart
notes: All grain products accepted
commonMistakes: Don't put in trash

materials.name: Coffee grounds / tea bags
instructions: Coffee grounds and paper filters: green composting cart
Paper tea bags: green cart (remove staple)
notes: Coffee grounds add nitrogen to compost
commonMistakes: Check tea bags are paper not plastic mesh

materials.name: Snacks and candy (food)
instructions: The food: green composting cart
The wrapper: trash
notes: Separate food from wrapper
commonMistakes: Don't put wrappers in green cart

materials.name: Condiments and sauces
instructions: The sauce: green composting cart
The bottle: rinse and put in blue recycling cart
notes: Separate container from contents
commonMistakes: Don't recycle bottles with sauce still in them

materials.name: Beverages / drinks
instructions: Pour leftover liquid down drain
Recycle the container in blue cart (cans, plastic bottles) or take glass to drop-off
notes: Focus on recycling the container; liquid goes down drain
commonMistakes: Don't recycle containers with liquid still in them
Glass bottles go to drop-off, NOT blue cart

materials.name: Eggs / eggshells
instructions: Crush eggshells and place in green composting cart
notes: Eggshells add calcium to compost
commonMistakes: Crush for faster breakdown

materials.name: Pet waste
instructions: Bag and place in trash
Do NOT compost pet waste
notes: Pet waste contains harmful bacteria
commonMistakes: Never compost pet waste
Don't flush cat litter

materials.name: Wax paper / parchment paper
instructions: Place in green composting cart. Austin accepts wax/parchment paper
Or trash if no composting
notes: Austin's composting program handles wax-coated paper
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Bubble wrap / packing materials
instructions: Place in trash
Or drop off plastic film at store collection bins
notes: Plastic film jams recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Aluminum foil
instructions: Clean off food residue
Ball up and place in blue recycling cart
notes: Clean foil is recyclable in Austin
commonMistakes: Don't recycle heavily soiled foil

materials.name: Cereal box
instructions: Flatten
Remove plastic liner bag (trash it)
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Thin paperboard is recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't forget to remove the plastic liner

materials.name: Toothbrush
instructions: Place in trash
notes: Mixed plastic; not recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Makeup / cosmetics
instructions: Most containers go in trash
Clean empty #1/#2/#5 containers may be recyclable
notes: Check brand take-back programs
commonMistakes: Small items fall through sorting screens

materials.name: Tires
instructions: Take to tire retailer or Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
notes: Most shops accept old tires when you buy new ones
commonMistakes: Don't dump illegally

materials.name: Mirror
instructions: Wrap carefully and place in trash
Label as BROKEN GLASS
notes: Metallic coating prevents glass recycling
commonMistakes: Never put in glass drop-off

materials.name: Ink / toner cartridges
instructions: Return to Staples or Office Depot in Austin
Manufacturers offer mail-back programs
notes: Some stores give credit for returns
commonMistakes: Don't throw in trash

materials.name: Fluorescent tubes
instructions: Take to Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
Home Depot and Lowe's also accept them
notes: Contains mercury; handle carefully
commonMistakes: Don't put in trash
Don't break them

compost: ALL food waste including meat, dairy, bones, and fish
Food-soiled paper (pizza boxes, paper plates, napkins, paper towels)
trash: Candy wrappers, chip bags, snack pouches

tips: NO GLASS in blue recycling cart; take glass to drop-off locations
ALL food goes in the green composting cart; including meat and dairy
Food-soiled paper goes in green cart, not blue
Plastic bags go to store drop-off, not curbside
Austin offers 2 free bulk pickups per year; schedule at Austin 311

locations.name: Austin Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
locations.notes: Free for Austin residents. Bring proof of residency.

locations.name: Household Hazardous Waste Facility
locations.notes: Same location as Resource Recovery Drop-off Center
